action: I want to safely upload business documents, contracts, specifications, and images, and manage them so only authorized personnel can view them
reason: To streamline information sharing while preventing leakage of confidential information and unauthorized downloads
acceptance_criteria: File upload is only executable by authenticated users.
Uploadable roles are controlled via permission management.
The maximum size per file is configurable (e.g., 20MB).
The maximum number of concurrent uploads is configurable.
Supported file formats are restricted (pdf, docx, xlsx, png, jpg, etc.).
Files with non-permitted extensions are rejected.
MIME type verification is performed (countermeasure against extension spoofing).
Upload processing is conducted via HTTPS communication.
File names are sanitized (countermeasure against path traversal).
Executable files (.exe, .sh, .js, etc.) cannot be saved.
Virus scanning is implemented for uploaded files.
If malware is detected, the file is not saved and the event is logged.
The storage path is not publicly exposed.
Downloads are possible only via signed URLs.
Signed URLs have an expiration date.
Access via direct links is rejected.
HTML files are not displayed directly to prevent XSS.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Files are stored in object storage (e.g., S3 compatible).
Storage paths are generated using UUIDs.
The original file name is retained as metadata.
The file size is recorded in the database.
The upload date and time are recorded.
The uploading user ID is recorded.
Logical deletion of files is possible.
Metadata is retained for audit purposes even after deletion.
Storage capacity limits can be set on a per-user basis.
Upload fails if the capacity limit is exceeded.
File viewing permissions are controlled by roles.
Access control based on the department unit is possible.
Only the uploader is permitted to edit.
Administrators can view all files.
Unauthorized users cannot download files.
File access logs are stored.
Logs include user_id, file_id, and timestamp.
File versioning is possible.
Old versions are retained when a new version is uploaded.
The updater and update timestamp are recorded in the version history.
Rollback to any arbitrary version is possible.
Large files support multipart (split) upload.
Upload processing can be handled via an asynchronous queue.
The target response time for the upload API is within 500ms.
Retry processing is performed in the event of storage failure.
Periodic backups are implemented.
Data retention period policies are configurable.
File upload success logs are stored.
File deletion logs are stored.
File download logs are stored.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Alerts occur upon detection of abnormal mass downloads.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
The internal storage path is not returned during API errors.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
